objects.ground: Winged platinum boots wait for the great paladin who left them behind.

extras.text: Small metal angelic wings extend from the heels of each boot, much like the classic symbol of an ancient deity.  The boots themselves are made of platinum plates, locked together reaching to the knees.  Each boot is surprisingly flexible due to the numerous joints.

objects.ground: A platinum bracer etched with a holy warrior's symbol rests on the ground.

extras.text: Large enough to cover from the wrist to beyond the elbow, this large bracer is both stylish and effective.  It covers almost the entire girth of an arm, with the small exposed section being mostly protected by hinges and buckles to hold the bracer securely in place.  The holy symbol of the original owner's order is shown in detailed relief on the face of the bracer.  The original owner's name is also etched on the inside.

objects.ground: Heavily enchanted platinum gauntlets appear to have misplaced here.

extras.text: Platinum plates fit together to form these secure but mobile gauntlets.  Each gauntlet is etched with numerous angelic and celestial runes, filling them with powerful holy magic.  Almost completely smooth in finish, the gauntlets almost appear to be fashioned from the hide of the legendary couatl.

objects.ground: A jet-black helm with demonic horns scorches the ground here!

extras.text: This helm is forged from some Stygian-black metal that does not burn but leeches the life out of the world around it.  From the side of the helm winds two large horns, gleaming with a sinister life of their own.  Black flames burn about the horns, showing their truly Infernal nature.

objects.ground: Some evil paladin's red-veined obsidian vambraces twinkle with a dark gleam here.

extras.text: The obsidian of the vambraces is run through with dark red swirls and streaks, like unholy blood coursing through the veins of a demon's hide.  The sight of a warrior clad all in armor of this nature would be awe-inspiring and horrific at the same time.

objects.ground: A dark warrior's grandiose demonic chestplate hangs in the air here.

extras.text: This chestplate bares the image of a huge demonic face, pounded out in bas-relief across the entire surface.  Forged from steel as burned as black as night, then molded and dedicated to a particular evil entity, the wearer is granted great unholy power, protecting them as they rain evil and chaos down on the realms.

objects.ground: Nasty, jagged looking fiery greaves have been put out on prominent display.

extras.text: Faint black flame surrounds these greaves, though they leave no burns when touched.  Combine that with the sharp, jagged points along the edges, these greaves appear to have come straight from some underworld realm.  Probably made of enchanted onyx or obsidian, these greaves are excellent armor for a dark warrior.

objects.ground: A pair of wicked-looking evil knight's boots stand at attention.

extras.text: These boots are an anomaly, for they have been polished smooth and clean, but they absorb all light and reflections, making them boots of palpable darkness. The occasional warp or buckle appears randomly on the surface, almost like the boots are straining to conform to their shape.

objects.ground: A dark knight's bracer lies on the ground, pulsing.

extras.text: This black bracer pulses in time with your heart, as if sounding out in response to your life force.  Warm to the touch and slightly organic in feel, this thing seems more like a parasite than a piece of armor.  Still, it is solid enough that it perhaps could be worn without problems.

objects.ground: Fiery black gauntlets lie discarded, forgotten by the their demonic owner.

extras.text: Wreathed in ever-burning flames, these gauntlets are horrible things indeed! Spiked protrusions cover the back of the hands, and the fingers reach out to end in demonic, claw-like digits.  Hollow like a shell, but heavy like stone, these gauntlets could well have been crafted from the carapace of some minor devil or demon.

objects.ground: Symbols of divine clarity adorn a mythril helm resting here.

extras.text: Large, decorative symbols for sight and clarity cover this sanctified helm. Both symbols are stylistically enclosed in the sign of the original wearer's patron spirit.  Blessed by the gods, this helm grants clerics a closer connection to their deities in their travels.

objects.ground: Mythril vambraces reverently await their owner here.

extras.text: These vambraces are forged from mythril, a metal that when in its purest form, can hold great spiritual power and divine favor.  Each set of vambraces like these is made for a specific cleric in the name of a specific deity, both of which are indicated in intricate designs across the surface of the plates.

objects.ground: A chestguard of mythril, adorned with angelic symbols, is propped up against a rock.

extras.text: Hugely stylized celestial runes have been engraved into this gorgeous chestguard.  Each rune relates to the domains of the original owner's deity, putting the priest into further contact with their gods' power.  Made of the purest mythril, this plate holds the strongest holy enchantments, designed not to make the wearer the warforce of the gods, but to be their voice and spirit among mortal man.

objects.ground: A pair of mythril greaves set with blessed amethysts lies on the floor.

extras.text: Powerful blessings have been bestowed on the gems in these greaves, attuning the wearer's body and soul with the higher realms.  Embossed on the mythril itself among the many celestial images is the original bearer's holy symbol.

objects.ground: Shining, radiant mythril boots gleam in the light here.

extras.text: These boots more than reflect light, they radiate with their own inner sanctified illumination.  Exquisite angelic designs and celestial glyphs cover each boot, identifying the wearer as a holy being.  The beauty of these boots is surpassed only by their holy purity.

objects.ground: A small mythril band, decorated with holy symbols has been discarded here.

extras.text: Numerous small blessings and wards have been scribed onto this bracer.  The spells themselves are written down in the shape of the divine symbol of the bearer's god.

objects.ground: A pair of divine mythril gauntlets has been placed on a small table here.

extras.text: Made more for protection and recognition than strength and battle prowess, these gauntlets are made from many small plates linked together, but are relatively unadorned.  Strong spiritual enchantments have been placed on these gauntlets however; the healing aura around them is unmistakable.

objects.ground: A qua-jit carapace hollowed out for a helm squats on the ground, empty.

extras.text: The stony but lightweight carapace of the qua-jit makes for excellent equipment, as is evident from this helm.  Enchanted with magic that enhances the wearer's natural visual acuity, a helm like this is often worn by rangers who have advanced to the highest skills.

objects.ground: Heavy white fur sleeves lie in the snow here.

extras.text: These sleeves are made from the thick, warm fur of the glacier beast, known to dwell in the frozen North.  Made normally to keep the wearer warm, glacier beast hide is also excellent for enchanting, the strength and fortitude of the great beasts being used to enhance a normal humanoid's.

objects.ground: A tunic made with red metal studs sits here in a heap.

extras.text: Shining red studs adorn the smooth brown leather of this beautiful tunic. Upon closer inspection, the leather appears to be that of a cliff griffin. This breed of griffin is both very rare and highly regarded for its natural magical properties, making a tunic like this nearly priceless. In the right light, the studs gleam with pristine grace, adding to their beauty and wonder.

objects.ground: Glowing fish-scale leggings rest on a rock here.

extras.text: These leggings are precisely manufactured of tightly bound fish scales, pulled together to make very flexible, but very strong armor.  Softly glowing and humming a nearly inaudible tune, these leggings bring to mind stories of the sea and of the merfolk that inhabit its depths.  Perhaps there is more to these seeming fish scales than meets the eye...

objects.ground: Boots made of large plate scales bake in the warm sun here.

extras.text: These boots are made from giant scales taken from the back of a giant scorpion. Naturally extremely resistant to blows, such scales make excellent equipment. Furthermore, creatures such as these make perfect challenges for rangers looking to test their skills.

objects.ground: An iridescent bracer shines up from a small pool of water.

extras.text: Made from a single large shell that must be grown for years, a bracer like this is given to rangers who have demonstrated their dedication to protecting the wilderness.  An abalone shell such as the one this is made from would be worth a fortune on the market, but that value pales in comparison to the magical enchantments it could contain.

objects.ground: Leather gauntlets of with small metal studs hang from a tree here.

extras.text: Alternating studs of copper and steel mesh together in these gauntlets, the mark of a ranking ranger.  The dichotomy of old and new represents the position of the ranger in the modern world - one who acts as both a protector and champion, preserving the best of the past while ushering in the new.

objects.ground: A wooden helm lies here tangled in vines.

extras.text: Unwilling to be dislodged, the vines have actually grown into and through the wood of this helm.  The helm itself appears to have been formed naturally, with very little if any human alteration.  Powerful natural magic emanates from this helm, indicating that it is more than what it seems.

objects.ground: Hollowed out oak tubes lie here, hidden under vines and leaves.

extras.text: Made from the holy oak, a symbol of strength and stability, these tubes are enhanced to act as natural armor.  Each sleeves is made of two smaller tubes, wrapped in leafy vines that act as threads and cords.  Not exactly a fashion statement, there is a raw natural beauty to these sleeves.

objects.ground: A painted and embroidered deer-hide tunic lies folded in the grass.

extras.text: This tunic is decorated with many natural images, ranging from leaves to great beasts.  Made from the hide of a stag, to the druids the most holy and respected of beasts, such a garment is granted only to high druids who have done much to spread the causes of nature.

objects.ground: Furry goat-hide pants flap from a nearby tree.

extras.text: These are no ordinary goat-hide pants!  Strange, residual fae magic lingers on them, indicating that powerful magic resided in the creature these were taken from.  Sewn with great care, leggings like these are quite special indeed.

objects.ground: A pair of pressed birch leaf and leather boots rests next to a dying fire.

extras.text: Several layers of pressed birch leaves have been sewn on to tanned hide to create these boots.  These boots still seem to be in sturdy condition, ready to handle any climate or condition, even though they have seen years of use.  Odd that the leaves still seem to be fresh, as if picked from a tree and stitched on this morning.

objects.ground: A single small lotus blossom sits on top of a twisted stem here.

extras.text: The stem of this lotus actually goes nowhere, ending in a simple knot. However, it could easily be wrapped around the wrist, creating a beautiful and exotic bracer.  The lotus is the ultimate representation of the ability of nature to produce beauty and perfection from the darkest of places.  Such an ever-growing blossom as this is created only for very powerful druids.

objects.ground: A glowing mass of silver spider webbing floats on the wind.

extras.text: Crafted from the incredibly rare silk of the silver spider, webbing such as this is nearly indestructible, in addition to being able to hold the most powerful enchantments.  These gloves are both beautiful and blithe, as soft as the light that glimmers off them and as soft as the wind.

objects.ground: A sallow face stares up at you from the ground.

extras.text: This hideous face is like a mask, only the eyes and mouth have been sewn shut and the edges of this face have been bunched up, like it is meant to be worn without strings.  Much larger than a normal human face, and much more rugged, this face appears to have been peeled off whole from someone, then prepared to be worn as some kind of hat.  The face feels moist, as if it was freshly harvested.

objects.ground: Decomposing leather sleeves have been tossed into a pile of trash.

extras.text: Upon closer inspection, these sleeves appear not to be normal leather, but much thinner and lighter than any other animal skin.  Also, they appear to have elbow joints already in them, and are turning putrid almost like they were taken straight from someone's arms and discarded.  Shorter than a human's, but larger around as well like a dwarf's, they look like they

objects.ground: An odd patchwork robe of mottled fur stinks up the room.

extras.text: This disgusting, stinky robe is made out of a large number of pelts, which appear not to have been tanned correctly, for there is evidence of decay and some structural instability.  The robe pelts feel less like a normal animal hide and given the color and variety of the pelts, it looks like this robe is made entirely from alley cat skins!

objects.ground: Long, slim hide leggings decompose in the corner.

extras.text: With only a single seam along the back, yet with knee joints and perfectly fitted hips and ankles somehow formed in them, these leggings must have been flayed right off of some being, stretched, stitched back up and then discarded without any further treatment.  Long and slim, these must have been taken from an elf, or someone with elven blood.

objects.ground: Odd furry little slippers have been tucked away out of sight here.

extras.text: These are not so much slippers as they are actual hollowed out feet, chopped off at the ankle!  The fur on them was obviously grown naturally before the foot was severed, and has been expertly, if not magically, preserved. Stitched together like shoes so as to allow anyone to wear them, the resemblance to halfling feet is unmistakable regardless.

objects.ground: A small plump piece of flesh rolls around here, molded into a crescent.

extras.text: In addition to the powerful death magic radiating from this weird fleshy bracelet, some small inherent illusory power still lingers in this horrid thing.  The bracelet is still in the process of decaying, the process being prolonged indefinitely by the necromantic powers placed in it.

objects.ground: Svelte human hands lie here on the floor, chopped off at the wrists.

extras.text: These hands are little more than skin now, having been cleaned and tanned to make gloves out of.  Necromantic magic makes it clear that these hands, while seeming fresh, were made to be used on a regular basis.  How horrible that someone would take another's hands, then rip them apart only to remake them as handwear!

objects.ground: An unadorned leather monastic headband sits on a shelf.

extras.text: A simple strip of leather, long enough to be wrapped around the head twice and then tied, this headband could in the loosest terms be described as a circlet. It reminds the wearer of the principles of monastic life over the trappings of fashion and material wealth.

objects.ground: Tough thick strips of leather coil around the arm of a monastic statue here.

extras.text: Armwraps like these would make for poor armor in any other situation, but in the hands of a truly dedicated monk, they function as a focus for internal strength and power.  The natural abilities of one such person come to the forefront, increasing their defensive and offensive capabilities.

objects.ground: Hanging from a wall is a bodysuit made of straps of leather.

extras.text: Easily worn under a robe or a cloak, this harness looks more like a fetishist's personal clothing than armor.  The entire suit is inscribed with scriptures, giving it a sort of holy torture that allows the wearer to clear their mind of all but themselves.  By transcending the limits of the body, the monk becomes one with the mind and the greater universe around them.

objects.ground: Short wooden leg plates tied together with long pieces of leather lie in a pile.

extras.text: The leather straps at the top and bottom of each plate are much longer than they should be, allowing each to be wrapped around the entire leg once, then tightened and tied off.  Such an armor style is very unique and actually functions fairly well as armor, as well as being a reflection of the simplicity of monastic life.

objects.ground: Plain, simple monastic slippers rest near a cot.

extras.text: Slippers of this sort are given to monks who have proven themselves as more than adepts and have moved to the level of a true master.  Stamped with the symbol for the original wearer's order, they are otherwise unadorned.  Made of tan leather, this pair is worn and obviously well used.

objects.ground: A hardened, treated monastic wristguard lies on the floor.

extras.text: Marked with only the symbol of a monk's order, this wristguard is very tough and hard, prepared to stand up to extreme use in a fight.  A gift like this is never given lightly, and is only given to those who have proven they know when to attack, and when to withdraw.

objects.ground: Dropped here are pliable but tough strips of leather with monastic scriptures on them.

extras.text: The most powerful weapon a monk master can ever use is his fists, and these wrappings prove that.  Meditation chants and order scriptures are written all over these strips which can be laced around the hands, protecting them like gloves and focusing all of a monk's energy into their strikes.  Written on one strap is a dedication to the original bearer.

objects.ground: The gaping maw of an evil god roars up from the floor here.

extras.text: Forged from metal as black as night, this helm looks like a roaring demon head. Cat-like eyes burn atop the helm, sharp teeth line the vicious maw and twisted black horns spiral up from the sides of this unholy headpiece.  Infernal magic radiates off this helm, burning away natural life and order.

objects.ground: Gleaming onyx vambraces burn coldly in a display case.

extras.text: These glossy onyx plates bear no decoration or distinguishing features, other than an unnatural coolness.  The source of the cold must have to do with the dark spiritual power that strengthens them, giving the onyx the strength of steel and empowering the wearer in the name of the dark gods.

objects.ground: Here an onyx chestguard calls out to its unholy lord.

extras.text: Polished smooth and inscribed with several Infernal symbols, chestguards of this variety are regarded as the pinnacle of evil devotion.  Given only to diabolists who have shown great dedication to furthering the goals of unholy forces, it brings the wearer into connection with their god, unifying them into a singular terrifying force.

objects.ground: A set of blackened etched greaves lies on a patch of seared earth.

extras.text: Perhaps made of steel, these greaves are blackened as if burned or charred, but still hold their original shape.  Small enough to wear comfortably under a long robe or cloak, but large enough to provide adequate protection, each plate is solid and sturdy, while not being bulky.  Each plate has the single symbol of the owner's deity on it, meticulously and elaborately etched into the face.

objects.ground: An unholy priest's black boots unhallow the ground around them.

extras.text: Clearly a gift from blasphemous powers, these boots ground the wearer to the darker side of the world, keeping them rooted in the physical world while expanding their powers in the spiritual realms.  No decoration has been added to these boots, save for faint magical traces that vein them.

objects.ground: A desecrated onyx bracer calls forth a dark god.

extras.text: More than it would seem, this bracer is actually stolen from a holy order, then transubstantiated through desecration into onyx.  Once the ritual is complete, it is imbued with specific energy from the god it is dedicated to.  That powerful link allows the bracer to call out to its god, pulling the wearer closer to that being.

objects.ground: Blood stained black gauntlets lie upon a dark altar.

extras.text: These gauntlets are covered in the blood of many sacrifices, each one dedicated to the diabolist for whom these gauntlets were forged.  Scorched in Infernal fires and tempered with unholy magic, the gauntlets lend the wearer aide in ritual and, of course, slaughter.

objects.ground: A powerful magic skullcap lies on the ground, waiting for its owner to return.

extras.text: Being in the presence of something like this is enough to know that deep arcane powers have been placed in this skullcap.  Made from simple cloth and studded with small aquamarines, it is not only very beautiful, it is capable of handling some of the most powerful enchantments.  This one is dedicated to seeing and clarity of vision.

objects.ground: Some archmage's long, elegant sleeves lie folded on a stand.

extras.text: Made from rich velvet, these sleeves bear the residual magic of many, many uses.  Originally crafted for a great archmage and clearly enchanted during that process, these sleeves have since taken on addition power from being used in numerous arcane rituals.

objects.ground: An extremely enchanted arcane robe is displayed here on a mannequin.

extras.text: This robe is made not from cloth or silk or any other known fabric, but is made from Wyrd Weave, a substance spun from the fabric of magic itself.  Such a robe is a vast undertaking to make, requiring the most powerful arcane substances and materials known.  Once created and attuned to a wearer, the robe changes to match a sorcerer's mood and style, as well as

objects.ground: Folded neatly in a bag here is a pair of deeply enchanted leggings.

extras.text: These long velvet leggings are given to very wise mages to assist in their pursuit of magical knowledge.  Usually crafted for a formal dedication ceremony, much room for magical development is left with these leggings, allowing them to grow with their wearer as a caster's magic grows in power.

objects.ground: A pair of slippers covered in arcane symbols has been left here.

extras.text: Simple cloth slippers are the basis for these embroidered shoes.  Created during a period of intense ritual working, each stitch, each fold, each piece of fabric bears a spell or enchantment to protect and fuel a grand wizard. Slippers like these are very powerful, very rare items that should be handled with care.

objects.ground: A bracelet made of pure arcane force rests amongst the rocks.

extras.text: Forged from solidified magic, this bracelet is the embodiment of true magical power.  Iridescent colors glint off the bracelet, which has a soft internal glow of its own.  The surface of the bracelet slides and reacts when touched, like oil on water, swirling the colors with the movement.

objects.ground: Gloves adorned with mystical runes lie next to an experiment station here.

extras.text: These gloves are used in magical experimentation and during mystic rituals. The runes on each glove represent different spheres of creation, enhancing a sorcerer's connection to said powers.  Sewn from simple cloth, then painted and decorated with pearls, these gloves are a mark of a very powerful sorcerer.

objects.ground: A nearly invisible hood blends into the darkest shadows of the room.

extras.text: Made out of pure shadow, a hood like this allows the wearer to do more than hide; they gain the senses of the shadows themselves.  Prized by rogues and assassins alike, a hood like this is rarely found, but given to a person who has advanced to the highest ranks in their guild.

objects.ground: Stuffed up into a small crevice is set of black, studded-leather sleeves.

extras.text: These sleeves flow like velvet but have the weight of a lighter fabric.  They rest quietly against any surface and allow for movement without making a sound. Magic was clearly involved in their creation for no normal leather offers these kinds of benefits without any drawbacks.

objects.ground: A lighter-than-air studded tunic eludes your eyes here.

extras.text: It is hard to discern the edges of this tunic, for they fade and shift from sight, as if actively avoiding detection.  While apparently made from black, studded leather, the tunic is lighter than most cloth and can be violently shaken without making a sound.  Tunics of this kind are often presented to high-ranking rogue guild members and are not given away lightly.

objects.ground: Magically silent studded leather leggings disappear on the ground.

extras.text: Obviously enchanted, these leggings are made from a single leather sheet covered with small black studds, yet they make absolutely no sound.  They play tricks with the light, fading in and out of sight occasionally, making both them and their wearer difficult to detect.

objects.ground: A pair of black studded-leather boots hides here from those who seek to find them.

extras.text: These boots are made from hardened leather, dyed black and covered with steel studs.  Eerily not a creak or a whisper comes from these boots, which makes them perfect for sneaking while armored.  In addition, they are very light, which keeps them from impeding movement.  A pair of boots like this would be a perfect gift for anyone who valued stealth and quickness.

objects.ground: A large black scrap of leather has been caught up in some tree branches here.

extras.text: This 'scrap' of leather is actually a perfect rectangle and has nicely finished edges and small, nearly invisible cords hanging from two sides.  In addition, it seems to be reinforced with bands of padding, making it comfortable to wear. It could easily be tied to the forearm, and would probably blend in well with the darkness.

objects.ground: Shadows pool together here, giving form to a pair of gloves.

extras.text: The shadows form into small metal studs spaced across the surface of these pure black gloves.  Clearly forged with magic, these gloves make no noise and are difficult to see.  They allow for a full range of motion with the hand, making them perfect for quick, deft tasks.

This seems to be a precious discovery, and it glimmers in the ambient light.

triggers.commands: * * This is the main receive trigger for the phased * armor quests installed on the mud. This trigger * is class and phase specific as defined below. * if (%actor.class% == sorcerer || %actor.class% == cryomancer || %actor.class% == pyromancer) && %actor.level% >= 41 && %actor.quest_stage[phase_armor]% >= 2 * * pertinient object definitions for this class * destroyed armor set vnum_destroyed_gloves 55359 set vnum_destroyed_boots 55363 set vnum_destroyed_bracer 55367 set vnum_destroyed_helm 55371 set vnum_destroyed_arm 55375 set vnum_destroyed_legs 55379 set vnum_destroyed_chest 55383 * gems for this class set vnum_gem_gloves 55679 set vnum_gem_boots 55690 set vnum_gem_bracer 55701 set vnum_gem_helm 55712 set vnum_gem_arm 55723 set vnum_gem_legs 55734 set vnum_gem_chest 55745 * rewards for this class set vnum_reward_helm 55552 set vnum_reward_arms 55553 set vnum_reward_chest 55554 set vnum_reward_legs 55555 set vnum_reward_boots 55556 set vnum_reward_bracer 55557 set vnum_reward_gloves 55558 * * attempt to reinitialize slutty dg variables to "" (nothing) * so this switch will work. * unset vnum_armor unset vnum_gem unset vnum_reward * * * These cases set varialbes for the * quest. * switch %object.vnum% case %vnum_destroyed_helm% set is_armor 1 case %vnum_gem_helm% set exp_multiplier 11 set vnum_armor %vnum_destroyed_helm% set vnum_gem %vnum_gem_helm% set vnum_reward %vnum_reward_helm% break case %vnum_destroyed_arm% set is_armor 1 case %vnum_gem_arm% set exp_multiplier 12 set vnum_armor %vnum_destroyed_arm% set vnum_gem %vnum_gem_arm% set vnum_reward %vnum_reward_arms% break case %vnum_destroyed_chest% set is_armor 1 case %vnum_gem_chest% set exp_multiplier 14 set vnum_armor %vnum_destroyed_chest% set vnum_gem %vnum_gem_chest% set vnum_reward %vnum_reward_chest% break case %vnum_destroyed_legs% set is_armor 1 case %vnum_gem_legs% set exp_multiplier 13 set vnum_armor %vnum_destroyed_legs% set vnum_gem %vnum_gem_legs% set vnum_reward %vnum_reward_legs% break case %vnum_destroyed_boots% set is_armor 1 case %vnum_gem_boots% set exp_multiplier 9 set vnum_armor %vnum_destroyed_boots% set vnum_gem %vnum_gem_boots% set vnum_reward %vnum_reward_boots% break case %vnum_destroyed_bracer% set is_armor 1 case %vnum_gem_bracer% set exp_multiplier 10 set vnum_armor %vnum_destroyed_bracer% set vnum_gem %vnum_gem_bracer% set vnum_reward %vnum_reward_bracer% break case %vnum_destroyed_gloves% set is_armor 1 triggers.name: phase_3_rogue_greet
triggers.commands: wait 2 if (%actor.class% == rogue || %actor.class% == thief || %actor.class% == assassin || %actor.class% == mercenary) && %actor.level% >= 41 if %actor.quest_stage[phase_armor]% == 2 wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, "Welcome, would you like to do some armor quests?" msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, "If so, just ask me, Yes I would like to do some armor quests" endif else endif

triggers.name: Phase_3_rogue_accept
triggers.argument_list: yes armor quests quest hello hi
triggers.commands: * * This will recognize the acceptance of the phase armor quest * by a player and set the quest variable for later interaction. * if (%actor.class% == rogue || %actor.class% == thief || %actor.class% == assassin || %actor.class% == mercenary) wait 2 if %actor.quest_stage[phase_armor]% == 2 quest advance phase_armor %actor.name% endif msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, "Excellent, I can make nice boots, a cap, gloves," msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, "sleeves, leggings, tunic, and a bracer." wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, "If you want to know about how to quest for one, ask me about" msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, "it and I will tell you the components you need to get for me" msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, "in order to receive your reward." wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, "Remember, you can ask me status at any time," msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, "and I'll tell you what you have given me so far." else msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, "Sorry, this quest is for rogues only." endif

triggers.name: warrior_phase_3
triggers.commands: * * This is the main receive trigger for the phased * armor quests installed on the mud. This trigger * is class and phase specific as defined below. * set class warrior if %actor.class% == %class% && %actor.level% >= 41 && %actor.quest_stage[phase_armor]% >= 2 * * pertinient object definitions for this class * destroyed armor set vnum_destroyed_gloves	55356 set vnum_destroyed_boots	55360 set vnum_destroyed_bracer	55364 set vnum_destroyed_helm	55368 set vnum_destroyed_arm	55372 set vnum_destroyed_legs	55376 set vnum_destroyed_chest	55380 * gems for this class set vnum_gem_gloves	55681 set vnum_gem_boots	55692 set vnum_gem_bracer	55703 set vnum_gem_helm	55714 set vnum_gem_arm	55725 set vnum_gem_legs	55736 set vnum_gem_chest	55747 * rewards for this class set vnum_reward_helm 55489 set vnum_reward_arms 55490 set vnum_reward_chest 55491 set vnum_reward_legs 55492 set vnum_reward_boots 55493 set vnum_reward_bracer 55494 set vnum_reward_gloves 55495 * * attempt to reinitialize slutty dg variables to "" (nothing) * so this switch will work. * unset vnum_armor unset vnum_gem unset vnum_reward * * * These cases set varialbes for the * quest. * switch %object.vnum% case %vnum_destroyed_helm% set is_armor 1 case %vnum_gem_helm% set exp_multiplier 11 set vnum_armor %vnum_destroyed_helm% set vnum_gem %vnum_gem_helm% set vnum_reward %vnum_reward_helm% break case %vnum_destroyed_arm% set is_armor 1 case %vnum_gem_arm% set exp_multiplier 12 set vnum_armor %vnum_destroyed_arm% set vnum_gem %vnum_gem_arm% set vnum_reward %vnum_reward_arms% break case %vnum_destroyed_chest% set is_armor 1 case %vnum_gem_chest% set exp_multiplier 14 set vnum_armor %vnum_destroyed_chest% set vnum_gem %vnum_gem_chest% set vnum_reward %vnum_reward_chest% break case %vnum_destroyed_legs% set is_armor 1 case %vnum_gem_legs% set exp_multiplier 13 set vnum_armor %vnum_destroyed_legs% set vnum_gem %vnum_gem_legs% set vnum_reward %vnum_reward_legs% break case %vnum_destroyed_boots% set is_armor 1 case %vnum_gem_boots% set exp_multiplier 9 set vnum_armor %vnum_destroyed_boots% set vnum_gem %vnum_gem_boots% set vnum_reward %vnum_reward_boots% break case %vnum_destroyed_bracer% set is_armor 1 case %vnum_gem_bracer% set exp_multiplier 10 set vnum_armor %vnum_destroyed_bracer% set vnum_gem %vnum_gem_bracer% set vnum_reward %vnum_reward_bracer% break case %vnum_destroyed_gloves% set is_armor 1 case %vnum_gem_gloves% set exp_multiplier 8 set vnum_armor %vnum_destroyed_gloves% set vnum_gem %vnum_gem_gloves% set vnum_reward %vnum_reward_gloves% break default return 0 wait 1 eye %actor.name% msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'I am not interested in this from you.' msend %actor% %self.name% returns your item to you. halt break done * * need to force character saving after each turnin. * if !%is_armor% * hrmm Jelos' magical variable declaration if %actor.quest_variable[phase_armor:%vnum_gem%_gems_acquired]% else quest variable phase_armor %actor.name% %vnum_gem%_gems_acquired 0 endif eval gems %actor.quest_variable[phase_armor:%vnum_gem%_gems_acquired]% quest variable phase_armor %actor.name% %vnum_gem%_gems_acquired %gems% if %gems% < 3 eval gems %actor.quest_variable[phase_armor:%vnum_gem%_gems_acquired]% + 1 quest variable phase_armor %actor.name% %vnum_gem%_gems_acquired %gems% wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, "Hey, very nice. It is good to see adventurers out conquering the" msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, "realm.  You have now given me %gems% %get.obj_shortdesc[%vnum_gem%]%." mjunk %object.name% msave %actor% else return 0 wait 2 eye %actor.name% wait 1 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, "Hey now, you have given me 3 already!" msend %actor% %self.name% returns your item to you. * * Halt here so that the reward section isn't checked if the max * number of armor pieces has already been turned in so the reward * can't be given multiple times. * halt endif * * check to see if the quest is complete and the reward can be given.. * If %gems% == 3 && %actor.quest_variable[phase_armor:%vnum_armor%_armor_acquired]% == 1 wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, "Excellent intrepid adventurer, you have provided me with all" msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, "I need in order to reward you with %get.obj_shortdesc[%vnum_reward%]%!" wait 1 mload obj %vnum_reward% wait 1 * * loop for exp award. * msend %actor% &3&bYou gain experience!&0 set lap 1 while %lap% <= %exp_multiplier% mexp %actor% 42840 eval lap %lap% + 1 done * Note while loops can't be indented, due to dumbass * coders. * end exp loop * * all other items should be mpjunked or whatever by now give all %actor.name% endif * * other if's for the armor turn-ins should go between here and the last object * else * here is where the armor section goes * that is true for is_armor == 1 * hrmm Jelos' magical variable declaration if %actor.quest_variable[phase_armor:%vnum_armor%_armor_acquired]% else quest variable phase_armor %actor.name% %vnum_armor%_armor_acquired 0 endif eval armor %actor.quest_variable[phase_armor:%vnum_armor%_armor_acquired]% quest variable phase_armor %actor.name% %vnum_armor%_armor_acquired %armor% if %armor% < 1 eval armor %actor.quest_variable[phase_armor:%vnum_armor%_armor_acquired]% + 1 quest variable phase_armor %actor.name% %vnum_armor%_armor_acquired %armor% wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, "Hey now. what have we here?!  I've been looking for some of this" msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, "for quite some time.  You have now given me %get.obj_shortdesc[%vnum_armor%]%." mjunk %object.name% msave %actor% else return 0 wait 2 eye %actor.name% wait 1 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, "Hey now, you have given me %get.obj_shortdesc[%vnum_armor%]% already!" msend %actor% %self.name% returns your item to you. * * Halt here so that the reward section isn't checked if the max * number of armor pieces has already been turned in so the reward * can't be given multiple times. * halt endif * * check to see if the quest is complete and the reward can be given.. * If %armor% == 1 && %actor.quest_variable[phase_armor:%vnum_gem%_gems_acquired]% == 3 wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, "Excellent intrepid adventurer, you have provided me with all" msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, "I need in order to reward you with %get.obj_shortdesc[%vnum_reward%]%!" wait 1 mload obj %vnum_reward% wait 1 * * loop for exp award. * msend %actor% &3&bYou gain experience!&0 set lap 1 while %lap% <= %exp_multiplier% mexp %actor% 42840 eval lap %lap% + 1 done * Note while loops can't be indented, due to dumbass * coders. * end exp loop * * all other items should be mpjunked or whatever by now give all %actor.name% endif endif * last object if before else that returns unwated objects to the player else * not the correct class for this particular quest? * * This return will prevent the actual give from * the player in the first place and make it look * like homeslice is giving the object back. * return 0 wait 1 eye %actor.name% msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'I am not interested in this from you.' msend %actor% %self.name% returns your item to you. endif

triggers.name: drop_phase_1_mini_boss_2
triggers.commands: * * Death trigger for random gem and armor drops * * set a random number to determine if a drop will * happen. * * Miniboss setup * set bonus %random.100% set will_drop %random.100% * 3 pieces of armor per sub_phase in phase_1 set what_armor_drop %random.3% * 4 classes questing in phase_1 set what_gem_drop %random.4% * if %will_drop% <= 30 * drop nothing and bail halt endif if %will_drop% <= 70 * Normal non-bonus drops if %bonus% <= 90 * drop a gem 55565 is the vnum before very first gem eval gem_vnum %what_gem_drop% + 55565 mload obj %gem_vnum% else * We're in the BONUS ROUND!! * drop a gem from the next wear pos set eval gem_vnum %what_gem_drop% + 55569 mload obj %gem_vnum% endif elseif (%will_drop% >= 71 && %will_drop% <= 90) * Normal non-bonus drops if %bonus% <= 90 * drop destroyed armor 55299 is the vnum before the * first piece of armor. eval armor_vnum %what_armor_drop% + 55299 mload obj %armor_vnum% else * We're in the BONUS ROUND!! * drop a piece of armor from next wear pos eval armor_vnum %what_armor_drop% + 55303 mload obj %armor_vnum% endif else * Normal non-bonus drops if %bonus% <= 90 * drop armor and gem eval gem_vnum %what_gem_drop% + 55565 eval armor_vnum %what_armor_drop% + 55299 mload obj %armor_vnum% mload obj %gem_vnum% else * We're in the BONUS ROUND!! * drop armor and gem from next wear pos eval gem_vnum %what_gem_drop% + 55569 mload obj %gem_vnum% eval armor_vnum %what_armor_drop% + 55303 mload obj %armor_vnum% endif endif

* drop a piece of armor from next wear pos eval armor_vnum %what_armor_drop% + 55315 mload obj %armor_vnum% endif else * Normal non-bonus drops if %bonus% <= 50 * drop armor and gem from previous wear pos eval gem_vnum %what_gem_drop% + 55573 eval armor_vnum %what_armor_drop% + 55307 mload obj %gem_vnum% mload obj %armor_vnum% elseif (%bonus% >= 51 && %bonus% <= 90) * We're in the Normal drops from current wear pos set * drop a gem and armor from the current wear pos set eval armor_vnum %what_armor_drop% + 55311 mload obj %armor_vnum% eval gem_vnum %what_gem_drop% + 55577 mload obj %gem_vnum% else * We're in the BONUS ROUND!! * drop armor and gem from next wear pos eval gem_vnum %what_gem_drop% + 55581 mload obj %gem_vnum% eval armor_vnum %what_armor_drop% + 55315 mload obj %armor_vnum% endif endif

rooms.name: The Cold Fields
rooms.description: This land is cold!  Most of the ground is covered in snow.  The air is thin and bites into you are you breath it in.  Snow drifts dominate the land and rock formations can be seen trailing through the tundra leftover from the mountain range south of here.  You notice some vegetation in the area but nothing could survive here for long.

rooms.name: The Nikozian Trail
rooms.description: You stand along a well traveled path that looks worn in the surrounding earth for many hundreds of years.  It's rocky in most places as though it were purposefully lined in stone to preserve the pathway for many years.  From here the view of the surrounding lands is breathtaking.  The trail runs north- west from here.

North.description: The trail continues to the north.

West.description: The trail continues to the west.

rooms.name: The Cold Fields
rooms.description: This land is cold!  Most of the ground is covered in snow.  The air is thin and bites into you are you breath it in.  Snow drifts dominate the land and rock formations can be seen trailing through the tundra leftover from the mountain range south of here.  You notice some vegetation in the area but nothing could survive here for long.

You notice some vegetation in the area but nothing could survive here for long.

rooms.name: The Nikozian Trail
rooms.description: You stand along a well traveled path that looks worn in the surrounding earth for many hundreds of years.  It's rocky in most places as though it were purposefully lined in stone to preserve the pathway for many years.  From here the view of the surrounding lands is breathtaking.  The trail runs north- west from here.

North.description: The trail continues to the north.

West.description: The trail continues to the west.
